message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CV 

This paper focuses on cross-domain sentiment classification, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML). Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes a method for distilling domain-invariant sentiment features, which involves training a model to detect aspects that vary widely in different domains. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to subcategories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which deal with topics related to ML and NLP. Finally, the paper may also be relevant to cs.CV (Computer Vision), as some of the techniques used in NLP and ML can also be applied to image and video analysis.
